lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court said on Wednesday the U.S. Federal Communications Commission could not block two states from setting limits on municipal broadband expansion, a decision seen as a win for private-sector providers of broadband internet and a setback for FCC Chairman Tom Wheeler.

headline.print_headline: Setback for the F.C.C. on Public Broadband
headline.main: U.S. Court Blocks FCC Bid to Expand Public Broadband

snippet: A federal appeals court said on Wednesday the U.S. Federal Communications Commission could not block two states from setting limits on municipal broadband expansion, a decision seen as a win for private-sector providers of broadband internet and a...
abstract: Federal appeals court rules that Federal Communications Commission cannot stop Tennessee and North Carolina from setting limits on municipal broadband expansion; decision is victory for private-sector broadband internet providers.
